dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3519620O] Abuse and copyright infringement on The Planet
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Saturday, March 17, 2007 1:48 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3519620O] Abuse and copyright infringement on
The Planet

==== Forwarded Ticket ====
1. Abuse and copyright infringement on The Planet
Added by system at Saturday, Mar 17 2007 06:25 am 
X-MailFrom: glynis@travel-quest.co.uk 
X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net 
Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for
<abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net>; Sat Mar 17 06:25:12 2007 
Received: (qmail 383 invoked by alias); 17 Mar 2007 11:25:12 -0000 
Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net 
Received: (qmail 380 invoked from network); 17 Mar 2007 11:25:11 -0000 
Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com (70.87.6.111) 
  by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 17 Mar 2007 11:25:11 -0000

Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by
smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); 
  Sat, 17 Mar 2007 06:25:11 -0500 
Return-path: <glynis@travel-quest.co.uk> 
Delivery-date: Sat, 17 Mar 2007 06:25:11 -0500 
Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181]
helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) 
 by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from glynis@travel-quest.co.uk) 
 with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) 
 (Exim) 
        id 1HSX26-0000Bv-T2 
        for abuse@theplanet.com; Sat, 17 Mar 2007 06:25:11 -0500 
Received: from mail.idnet.net.uk ([212.69.36.63]) 
        by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from
glynis@travel-quest.co.uk) 
        with esmtps (TLSv1:EDH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:168) 
        (Exim) 
        id 1HSX23-0004tz-ER 
        for abuse@theplanet.com; Sat, 17 Mar 2007 06:25:07 -0500 
Received: from [212.69.44.165] by mail.idnet.net.uk (GMS 
 11.01.3365/NU3963.00.7ca42f0c) with ESMTP id gdupetaa for 
 abuse@theplanet.com; Sat, 17 Mar 2007 11:25:00 +0000 
User-Agent: Microsoft-Entourage/11.0.0.040405 
Date: Sat, 17 Mar 2007 11:22:09 +0000 
Subject: Abuse and copyright infringement on The Planet 
From: Glynis Edwards <glynis@travel-quest.co.uk> 
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>, 
        <copyright@theplanet.com> 
Message-ID: <C2217FE1.7DE2%glynis@travel-quest.co.uk> 
Mime-version: 1.0 
Content-type: multipart/alternative; 
        boundary="B_3256975329_386243" 
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Mar 2007 11:25:11.0469 (UTC)
FILETIME=[ED0395D0:01C76886] 

 (multipart/alternative) 
Multipart prefix (text/plain) 
> This message is in MIME format. Since your mail reader does not
understand 
this format, some or all of this message may not be legible. 
 
MIME element (text/plain) 
Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services Inc, 
 
I would like to report a site -- http://www.uktravelnet.com -- who
reside on 
your server 69.93.99.66. We have just discovered that this site has 
completely stolen our content and, after replacing any occurrences of
our 
business name with their own name, they are now displaying our content
as 
their own! 
 
I rang your support line who advised me to report this to the 
abuse@theplanet.com address. Since then I have seen information on your
site 
that suggests I should report it to your legal team at 
copyright@theplanet.com, so I am sending this email to both addresses. 
 
Apart from the fact that the material taken is entirely our copyright,
we 
are very concerned that the duplicate content might be adversely
affecting 
our ranking in the Search Engines! We would like to request that you
remove 
this material from your servers with all possible haste. 
 
---------------------------------------------- 
(I believe the following statements are required before you can proceed
with 
any action) 
 
Statements:  
 
I verify that I, Glynis Edwards owner of Travel-Quest, am the owner of
the 
copyrighted material which is the material found on the website 
http://www.travel-quest.co.uk. 
 
I, as the complaining party, have a good faith belief that the use of
the 
material in the manner complained of is not authorized by me, the
copyright 
owner, its agent, or the law. 
 
I verify that the information in the notification is accurate, and under

penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to act on 
behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. 
Glynis Edwards 
Owner, travel-quest.co.uk 
 
---------------------------------------------- 
 
Details of our complaint: 
 
We own the URL:  
http://www.travel-quest.co.uk and have run our travel directory on this
URL 
since November 1998 
 
Our WhoIs info:  
http://webwhois.nic.uk/cgi-bin/whois.cgi?query=travel-quest.co.uk&WHOIS+
Subm 
it.x=6&WHOIS+Submit.y=12 
 
Our office address is: 
travel-quest.co.uk, Quest Directories, 40 Magdalen Avenue, Bath, BA2
4QB, 
United Kingdom 
Phone: 01225 481 470  Fax: 01225 420 869 
As can be seen on our site contact page and as is also shown on the
Alexa 
record: 
http://www.alexa.com/data/details/contact_info?url=www.travel-quest.co.u
k 
(uktravelnet.com have deleted the postal address from their version of
the 
contact page and you will note that none of their email forms work!) 
 
The information on Internet Archive Wayback Machine should also help
verify 
ownership: 
http://web.archive.org/web/*/www.travel-quest.co.uk 
 
If you wish to see a handwritten signature I will gladly fax this to
you, on 
our letter headed paper. If you also wish to see a signature from Mr
Paul 
Riddy (Quest Designs, 79 Clarendon Road, Shirley, Southampton, Hants,
SO16 
4GD, UK), who is the person named on our WhoIs information (but who is a

sleeping partner in the business now), I can also arrange that. Please
let 
me know if either or both of this is required and what fax number to
send it 
to. 
 
---------------------------------------------- 
For further verification of our ownership of the material: 
 
On the offending site, please go to the home page and try a search in
the 
search box at the top right of the page, in the results you will see
that 
the top banner is showing our top banner and that the results listed
link to 
travel-quest.co.uk -- not uktravelnet.com. The search is provided by an 
external service and uktravelnet.com cannot control the results. 
 
On the offending site, please see http://www.uktravelnet.com/promo1.htm
and 
look at the link in the text to 'Shoreline Hotel', this is an affiliate
link 
and you will see we are directly identified in this link 
(http://butlins.at/travelquest@DURL=http_3A_ ...) 
Also see http://www.uktravelnet.com/tqhome.htm and look at the Amazon
button 
in the left-hand margin, this is also an affiliate link and again we are

directly identified as the affiliate -- there are many, many similar 
examples throughout the site and, if necessary, I can get the Affiliate 
Networks concerned to confirm to you that the less easy to identify 
affiliate links are also using our unique id's. 
 
On the offending site, go to 
http://www.uktravelnet.com/editorial/cyclekids.htm and read the image
alt 
tags on the top banner, which read "return to travel-quest specialist 
travel" etc. 
 
There are also a fair number of pages that uktravelnet.com failed to
steal, 
so internal links to these do not work, see 
http://www.uktravelnet.com/tqyoga.htm and try the link to Karuna Yoga
School 
at the foot of the page, or the link to an article about Karuna Yoga
School 
in the left hand side column. Again I can find you plenty more examples
if 
required. 
 
We are listed in the ODP at: 
http://dmoz.org/Recreation/Travel/Guides_and_Directories/ 
We are listed on Yahoo at: 
http://dir.yahoo.com/Regional/Countries/United_Kingdom/Business_and_Econ
omy/ 
Shopping_and_Services/Travel_and_Transportation/Directories/ 
A newspaper article from The Guardian (a very well respected, top UK 
newspaper), dated March 6 2004: 
http://travel.guardian.co.uk/article/2004/mar/06/travelwebsites.internet
.gua 
rdiansaturdaytravelsection links to our site. 
 
Internet Archive Wayback Machine: 
http://web.archive.org/web/*/www.uktravelnet.com clearly shows that 
uktravelnet.com was not using our information prior to (at least) Feb
2006, 
compare that to Wayback information for our site: 
http://web.archive.org/web/*/www.travel-quest.co.uk 
 
Please let me know if you need further verification. 
 
---------------------------------------------- 
What we have discovered about uktravelnet.com: 
 
WhoIs info: 
http://reports.internic.net/cgi/whois?whois_nic=uktravelnet.com&type=dom
ain 
And this one, which is showing an address in China (but it doesn't
always 
display full details): 
http://www.dnsstuff.com/tools/whois.ch?ip=www.uktravelnet.com 
>> Registrant: GoFly Media, 46-3-501 TianShuiYuan DongLi, beijing, NA
100026, CN 
>> Domain name: UKTRAVELNET.COM 
>>  
>> Administrative Contact: xiaofei, song  fifthseason78@yahoo.ca 
>> 46-3-501 TianShuiYuan DongLi, beijing, NA 100026, CN 
>> +1.4047450137  Fax: +1.4047450137 
>>  
>> Technical Contact: (same as admin contact) 
>>  
>> Registrar of Record: REGISTERFLY.COM, INC. 
>> Record expires on 05-Jan-2008. 
>> Record created on 05-Jan-2005. 
>>  
>> Domain servers in listed order: 
>> NS2.ICH-6.COM   69.93.99.67 
>> NS1.ICH-6.COM   69.93.99.66 
>>  
>> Domain status: clientTransferProhibited, clientUpdateProhibited 
>  
On Alexa the following information is given about the ownership of 
uktravelnet.com: 
http://www.alexa.com/data/details/main?q=&url=www.uktravelnet.com 
>> Contact Info for uktravelnet.com: 
>> Racing-Live Network, 5 Great Marlborough St, London W1V 2AR, UNITED
KINGDOM 
>> 2255 390 5541, Fax: 225539062  info [at] racing-live.co.uk 
Although I suspect that this information is out-of-date, or details of a

previous owner, because the phone and fax numbers are "unobtainable"
when 
dialled. 
 
I can confirm that the site was stolen some time around the 19th
December 
2006 (we can tell this by noting which companies are listed as 'recent 
additions', but also take a look at the offers on the news page which
are 
showing Christmas deals and out-of-date offers!) 
 
---------------------------------------------- 
 
I sincerely hope you can help in this as it is damaging our business.
Please 
let me know if your require any additional information form us. We look 
forward to your reply. 
 
Yours sincerely, 
Glynis Edwards 
Owner, travel-quest.co.uk
